title: As an Administrator how do I setup a new user,staff member is Practice Management?
path: /Wiki - TAP UK Support/Wikipedia/Supported programs/DIGITA/Practice Management/As an Administrator how do I setup a new user,staff member is Practice Management?
content:
**Question** 
As an Administrator how do I setup a new user/staff member is Practice Management?

**Answer**
If you are acting as the Administrator and are responsible for creating User Accounts for staff at
your practice there is a two step process, firstly setting up the Staff Member record then the User.

To setup the Staff Member record, choose File | New | New Staff Member (If you the user isn't going
to complete a Time sheet within Practice Management the only mandatory field here is the Full
Name, you should however enter the staff's email address in the Contact Details section if the user is
going to be interacting with Onvio).

If the user is going to complete a Time sheet you will need to add their charge out rate, to do this;
click Action | Charge-out Rates (Alternatively click on the £ icon) and enter the details as necessary
(ensure you enter the valid from date from the user started) by clicking on New or Edit and click OK to
save the details as illustrated below
![image.png](/.attachments/image-cfd0c009-06e0-43c2-bb21-519fd8c97aca.png)
Once the Staff Member record is setup we need to create the User, choose Tools | Manage Users and click New
![image.png](/.attachments/image-a8a8733f-ddd4-41b6-ba1f-741bca8e768d.png)
To enter the User name click on the Ellipsis button to the right of the User Name field (If you user
Digita Virtual Office (DVO) this will display a list of your firms Staff that have been setup to access
DVO which can be selected)
In the Enter the object name to select box enter the users Windows log In name.
![image.png](/.attachments/image-c807f1bd-84d0-4dc7-860b-e82246354843.png)
Press Check Names to validate the user (If you get an error message saying that the user cannot be
found you can press the Advanced button then Find Now to display all of users setup on your firms
network, you can then select the user from this list).
Press OK to pull the validated user it through to the New User screen.
To link the Staff Member record to the User press the button to the right of the Staff Member box,
this will open a list of the Staff Members that have been setup on the system, double click on the
required user and press OK.
You can now choose the User's Role from the dropdown list.
Finally press OK, the user you have setup will now be able to access Practice Management and if
required enter time on their Time Sheet

[As an Administrator how do I setup a new user_staff member is Practice Management.pdf](/.attachments/As%20an%20Administrator%20how%20do%20I%20setup%20a%20new%20user_staff%20member%20is%20Practice%20Management-d7cb4914-9c98-4f4c-b2b1-cad92e38cf35.pdf)

title: Can I edit a finalised invoice if a mistake has been made?
path: /Wiki - TAP UK Support/Wikipedia/Supported programs/DIGITA/Practice Management/Can I edit a finalised invoice if a mistake has been made?
content:
**Question** 
Can I edit a finalized invoice if a mistake has been made?

**Answer**
Finalised invoices are locked down, apart from allowing you to add WIP or remove WIP from
the existing bill lines.

Currently there is no way to edit the details contained in a finalised invoice within Practice
Management if a mistake has been made. So a Credit Note needs to be raised to cancel
out the invoice on the ledger and a fresh invoice will then need to be created containing the
correct information.

If WIP has been added to the original invoice, you can remove this (so that it is available to
pull through to the replacement invoice) by opening the invoice and going into the bill line(s):
Right click on the WIP entry and select Remove WIP. Save & Close the bill line. Save &
Close the invoice.

The development team are aware that several customers have indicated that they would like
the ability to make minor edits to finalised bills - such as editing the description - and they
are looking to enhance the program to allow this in a future upgrade.
If it is just a minor error on the return, such as a slight spelling mistake, then you may wish
to elect to export the invoice to RTF so that you can edit the customer's copy in Word, rather
than create a fresh invoice, but please bear in mind that the invoice details saved in the
database will remain unchanged.

[Can I edit a finalised invoice if a mistake has been made.pdf](/.attachments/Can%20I%20edit%20a%20finalised%20invoice%20if%20a%20mistake%20has%20been%20made-c0ed988a-2f91-480a-849e-5e1903e06f74.pdf)

content:
**Question**
Client summary Tax Gadget. Message says check the 'DPT Server', and 'DPT Database Name' options of the gadget.

**Answer**
To review / set the "DPT Server" and the "DPT Database Name" options for the gadget*, highlight the
client name in the top right hand corner of the client summary screen, so that the orange drop down
arrow appears and select Personalize Content from the menu.

Then hover over the 'Tax Liability Gadget' heading so that the orange drop down arrow appears and
select Options from the menu:

The DPT Database Name will normally be 'TaxyWin'.

The DPT Server default is 'localhost'. Please change this to show the name of your server.

If the message now disappears, but the required figures are not shown as expected. This is because
you have not yet set Windows Authentication for Personal, Business & Trust Tax within Database
security for the User(s)... See link below.

* Log on as The Administrator to set this globally. If any Users have already personalised their view
this will not be over-written, but they can elect to "Reset Content" and accept the Administrator's new
settings by hovering over the client name in the top right hand corner of the Client Summary Screen,
so the orange drop down arrow appears and selecting Reset Content from the menu.

Message says check the DPT Server, and 'DPT Database Name options of the gadget.pdf](/.attachments/Client%20summary%20Tax%20Gadget.%20Message%20says%20check%20the%20DPT%20Server,%20and%20'DPT%20Database%20Name%20options%20of%20the%20gadget-38c0c37d-ff90-4f57-b99d-d941893aded7.pdf)

title: Document Creation - How do I setup and run a mail merge
path: /Wiki - TAP UK Support/Wikipedia/Supported programs/DIGITA/Practice Management/Document Creation - How do I setup and run a mail merge
content:
**Question** How do I setup and run a mail merge (Document Creation)

**Answer**
In order to run a mail merge, you will first need to set up a template, to do this;
1. Select Tools | Manage Office Document templates.
2. You then have the option to create a new template, modify an existing template or clone a template.
There are various reports supplied with the software which may help setting up your templates
- Blank address: A blank template with the basic address merge fields.
- Engagement cover: Contains the address fields and some example text.
- Marketing demo: Also contains the address fields and some example text.
- Label: Setup to enable you to create labels, however you would need to edit the template to suit the
type of label you are printing.
3. Having selected the method of editing the template, Microsoft Word will open and will enable you to
enter the text in the body of the template. You can also select the merge fields to use from the Mailings
tab, and selecting insert merge field.
(Please note, if you add a Header and/or Footer the details contained will only appear if you elect to
view the document for printing. If you wish these details to also be available if the document is used
for emails, please ensure ALL details are added to the main body of the template, and not added as a
header or footer, as headers and footers are stripped out when the details go onto email).
4. Once you have the information and the desired template format save the file. This will save the
template to the Practice Management Templates folder and is now ready to use with your Practice
Management client data.
To create the mail merge:
1. From the client or contact list highlight the entities you would like to create a document for.
2. Select the option to “Create office document”, this will launch the Mail merge wizard.
3. Click Next.
4. Select Generate a document using a template and click Next.
5. Select a template from the list and click Next
6. Add a Reference and/or Signatory as required. Ensure you have included the Signature merge
data field in your selected template; otherwise the signature will not be included.
7. Choose where to save the documents to. Select the Save to FileCabinet/Save to client/Contact
folder check boxes as required. Specify the default filename format by selecting your chosen
parameters from the drop-down list using the button. You can also enter any additional text to create a
customised filename. Any standard characters valid for filenames are allowed; invalid characters
include /\:*?"<>|. Click Next.
8. Set any additional options. Select the Save datasource file check box to save the file as a CommaSeparated (.csv) file.
Select the Add note to each recipient's contact history check box and specify a note to track who
has received letters. These appear on the Notes lists on the General tab, and is a useful way to track
who has received letters.
9. Click Next.
10. Select how you wish to send the document.
If you select Open document for printing:
1. The letters are created in a Word document.
2. You are asked to select to print each document separated by page breaks or section breaks. Click
Next.
3. View the Wizard summary to confirm the details and template are correct. Click Next to create the
documents.
4. Print the documents, then close and save the file for future reference.
5. If you wish to save these steps, for use again as a Fast Letter please tick the box to Save Settings
to Database (or leave the box unticked if not applicable). Click Finish to close the Wizard.
If you select Send documents via email:
1. Digita Practice Management requests access to your email application. The emails are sent from
the account to which you grant access via this dialog.
This does not apply any signatures specified via your email application. Therefore you may wish to
edit templates to include any required signature and disclaimer information.
2. Enter a title in the Subject field. This field is mandatory.
3. Choose whether to send the documents as an attachment or in the body of the email.
4. In the Output field, select whether to:
- Send the emails immediately
- Save the emails in your Drafts folder
- Open each email.
5. The emails are sent to the primary email for each selected contact/client. If there is no valid email
specified for a contact/client you are warned and asked whether to proceed. Clients are not able to
see the other recipients on the list, each email only contains one client in the To: field.
6.If you specified a Note it is only applied to clients/contacts that have had the email successfully sent.
You may want to set up some categories for each set of emails. You can then select this category on
this note, to signify the contacts/clients that have received the email.
If you select I do not wish to send the documents:
The documents are created and saved to the clients' folders.

[Document Creation - How do I setup and run a mail merge.pdf](/.attachments/Document%20Creation%20-%20How%20do%20I%20setup%20and%20run%20a%20mail%20merge-95c2ba28-7431-4a18-9f13-a7a42fea9233.pdf)

title: Document Creation - How to add a user input field when running a mail merge in Practice Management
path: /Wiki - TAP UK Support/Wikipedia/Supported programs/DIGITA/Practice Management/Document Creation - How to add a user input field when running a mail merge in Practice Management
content:
**Question** Document Creation - How to add a user input field when running a mail merge in Practice Management

**Answer**
Microsoft Word includes a Fill-in field which enables you to enter your own text at a certain point
within a document when running a mail merge.
To include a Fill-in field as part of a mail merge:
- Edit the Mail merge template from the Tools | Manage Office Document Templates, select
the relevant template and modify.
- To insert a fill-in field, place the cursor on the location in the template where you want the
information to be displayed.
- On the Mailings tab, in the Write & Insert Fields group, click Rules, and then click Fill-in.
- In the Prompt box, type the question you want answered.
- If you want a predefined response, type the response in the Default fill-in text box.
- If you want the same response to apply to all the records in the merge, select the Ask once
check box. If you do not check this you will be prompted to enter the information included in
your mail merge for each document.
Now when you run the mail merge you will be prompted (when the Practice Management mail merge
wizard has completed) to enter the text you want to display in the Fill-in field.

[Document Creation - How to add a user input field when running a mail merge in Practice Management.pdf](/.attachments/Document%20Creation%20-%20How%20to%20add%20a%20user%20input%20field%20when%20running%20a%20mail%20merge%20in%20Practice%20Management-eb702ce6-4b0b-4b5c-a0f5-0460b4a040ec.pdf)

title: Document Creation - How to change the date format in a word document, so that does not appear as DD,MM,YYYY 00:00:00
path: /Wiki - TAP UK Support/Wikipedia/Supported programs/DIGITA/Practice Management/Document Creation - How to change the date format in a word document, so that does not appear as DD,MM,YYYY 00:00:00
content:
**Question** 
Document Creation - How to change the date format in a word document, so that does not appear as DD/MM/YYYY 00:00:00

**Answer**
Any dates, such as date of birth or year end, are pulled from the database as DateTime types, so you
will need to format the field in the Word Template to the desired format.
To do this:
- Open the template - You should be able to see the merge fields e.g. «RecipientYearEnd»
- Hold down ALT and press F9 - This will display the merge field code e.g. {MERGEFIELD
"RecipientYearEnd" }
- Edit this to read the format you require e.g. 31 January {MERGEFIELD
"RecipientYearEnd" \@ " DD MMMM"}
- Hold down ALT and press F9 to return to normal mode
- Save the template.
When you now run the merge process the dates will be presented as 31 January rather than
31/01/2000 00:00:00

title: Document Creation - How to email a file to client using Practice Management
path: /Wiki - TAP UK Support/Wikipedia/Supported programs/DIGITA/Practice Management/Document Creation - How to email a file to client using Practice Management
content:
To send a file to multiple clients from Practice Management follow the guidance below.
1. From the client or contact list highlight the entities you would like to send the file too.
2. Select the option to Create office document, this will launch the Mail merge wizard.
3. Click Next.
4. Select Select a Document to File or Email and click Next.
5. Press the ellipsis button to select the file you wish to send, click Next.
6. On the next dialog choose Next
7. On the Email Options dialog, enter the subject of the email in the Subject field. This
field is mandatory.
8. Choose whether to send the documents as an attachment or in the body of the email
(If you choose to send as an attachment type what you want to be in the body of the
email in the Body section).
9. In the Output field, select whether to:
- Send the emails immediately
- Save the emails in your Drafts folder
- Open each email.
10. Click Next
11. The emails are sent to the primary email for each selected contact/client. If there is
no valid email specified for a contact/client you are warned and asked whether to
proceed. Clients are not able to see the other recipients on the list, each email only
contains one client in the To: field.
12. Select Finish

title: Document Creation - How to produce a mail merge document with figures from Personal, Business and Trust Tax?
path: /Wiki - TAP UK Support/Wikipedia/Supported programs/DIGITA/Practice Management/Document Creation - How to produce a mail merge document with figures from Personal, Business and Trust Tax?
content:
**Question** How to produce a mail merge document with figures from Personal, Business and Trust Tax?

**Answer**
You are able to create letter in Practice Management which pull figures from Personal, Business & Trust Tax
Before you are able to create the document using the Document Creator function in Practice
Management you need to ensure you have setup Windows Authentication in Personal, Business
and Trust Tax.
How to set Windows Authentication in Personal, Business & Trust Tax.
You will also need to turn on a setting in Practice Management you to choose which tax years details
are pulled through.
The setting is in Advanced Options (You will need to be logged in as the Administrator (File | Log on
as Administrator)) then Tools | Options | Advanced Options.
The required setting is Doc. data options, find this and double click and set this to True
With this option set you will be prompted to choose the Tax Year each time you create a Mail Merge
letter in Practice Management
Once these two steps have been carried out you are all set to start creating your templates letters.
To see how to create a Mail Merge and send to your clients please see this article
How do I setup and run a mail merge
How to create an email mail merge.
You can see a list of which fields are available to pull through into your templates from Personal,
Business and Trust Tax by going into the Help in Practice Management and searching for 'Merge
Data'
![image.png](/.attachments/image-f3b2e5d0-84d9-4062-9b9e-e5c05657a578.png)
We would advise that you produce an Excel spreadsheet in Practice Management to see which
figures pull through to which field allowing you to choose the correct one to use in your letter

title: Document Creation - How to save and use Fast Letters in Practice Management
path: /Wiki - TAP UK Support/Wikipedia/Supported programs/DIGITA/Practice Management/Document Creation - How to save and use Fast Letters in Practice Management
content:
**Question** Document Creation - How to save and use Fast Letters in Practice Management

**Answer**
You can save the selections made during the creation of a document after going through the steps in
the Mail Merge Wizard as a macro, so that every time you wish to create the document from then on
you don't have to go through the selection process again.

Once you have been through the steps to run a mail merge, the Finish option within the Mail Merge
Wizard gives you the option to Save Settings to Database.

If you tick this box, you can save the selections made use again in the future without having to re
select the same options. You will need to give the Fast Letter a name to identify this instance and
then select Finish
![image.png](/.attachments/image-8c066c03-8c88-42b1-9c08-b37561239832.png)
Now if you select one or more clients from the client list for whom you wish to create a document in
the future and right click; you will have the option to select Create Fast Letter and then select the
relevant instance which will automatically select all the options you saved.
![image.png](/.attachments/image-67974a0b-aeb8-49ea-9eac-a8b9bb5aea0b.png)
Configurations saved are only available to the individual user who has saved them. If you wish to
save Fast Letters at a global level that are available for everyone to use, you will need to login as the
Administrator (File | Login as Administrator) and go through the mail merge process and save the
options.

[Document Creation - How to save and use Fast Letters in Practice Management.pdf](/.attachments/Document%20Creation%20-%20How%20to%20save%20and%20use%20Fast%20Letters%20in%20Practice%20Management-e9e909b2-699f-4617-a0c2-5031f7909097.pdf)

title: Document Creation - How to set up a mail merge template to include the date created and not automatically update when the client document is opened in the future
path: /Wiki - TAP UK Support/Wikipedia/Supported programs/DIGITA/Practice Management/Document Creation - How to set up a mail merge template to include the date created and not automatically update when the client document is opened in the future
content:
**Question** 
Document Creation - How to set up a mail merge template to include the date created and not
automatically update when the client document is opened in the future.

**Answer**
You can add a date field to your letter templates that will retain the date the letter was created. This
date won't update each time the saved letter is opened.
To do this we can use the QUOTE function, this turns the output into a string rather than a field so it
doesn’t get updated.
You will need to create a merge field with the following content on the mail merge template:
{QUOTE {DATE \@ "dd/MM/yyy"} }
To enter this you need to:
1. Display field codes (ALT+F9)
2. Then use CTRL+F9 to enter create the {}
3. Type QUOTE then CTRL+F9 again to give {QUOTE{}}
4. Then type DATE \@"dd/MM/yyyy" to give {QUOTE{DATE \@"dd/MM/yyyy"}}
5. Then turn off field code display (ALT+F9)


[Document Creation - How to set up a mail merge template to include the date created and not automatically update when the client document is opened in the future.pdf](/.attachments/Document%20Creation%20-%20How%20to%20set%20up%20a%20mail%20merge%20template%20to%20include%20the%20date%20created%20and%20not%20automatically%20update%20when%20the%20client%20document%20is%20opened%20in%20the%20future-7ca45e82-e04b-4d36-9969-e5dea89872fa.pdf)

title: Document Creation - Why do I get the message 'Word cannot find it''s data source...' when trying to run, modify or create a letter?
path: /Wiki - TAP UK Support/Wikipedia/Supported programs/DIGITA/Practice Management/Document Creation - Why do I get the message 'Word cannot find it''s data source...' when trying to run, modify or create a letter?
content:
**Question**
Document Creation - Why do I get the message 'Word cannot find it''s data source...' when trying to run, modify or create a letter?


**Answer**
If you get the following error message when opening a template
![image.png](/.attachments/image-12b209ed-b69b-4922-b52a-3e8ba05652e7.png)
You will need to reattach the correct Clientdata.csv file as the data source of the letter.

First, you will need to find out the location of data source file by logging on as Administrator (File |
Log on as Administrator) and going into Tools | Options | General Options and selecting the
Defaults tab. The data source file can be found on the path in the Datasource file'.

Now that you know the location, please go into Manage Office Document Templates, click on the
affected template and click on Modify. You may get a splash screen saying that an error has occurred
as object path could not be found and asking you to check it... click OK

You will then be prompted to Find Data Source. Please browse to pick up the default path to the Data
source file.

When the document opens select the Mailings tab | Select Recipients | Use Existing List
![image.png](/.attachments/image-6039eac8-36a7-40ef-8dbc-4082a4a072a2.png)
Again locate the relevant csv data source file. When prompted select OK, and then save the
template.

This template will now have the correct data source file and you should be able to use this in Practice
Management without any further errors.

Any new documents that are created should now automatically be created using the correct csv data
source file.

title: DPM - Query did not return a unique result: 2
path: /Wiki - TAP UK Support/Wikipedia/Supported programs/DIGITA/Practice Management/DPM - Query did not return a unique result: 2
content:
**Problem** 
A 'Query did not return a unique result: 2' error appears when an Onvio login prompt usually would.

![image.png](/.attachments/image-7b75e1bb-c9fb-4d5d-91c8-5c30ab82da55.png)
The above error appears when a login prompt for Onvio would usually pop-up, such as starting the esigning process or viewing historic e-signing submissions.

**Solution **
This issue is caused by too many Practice Management users being mapped to the same active
directory or domain user account. This is most likely due to domain name changes and/or windows
user account name changes

To solve the issue, you will need to ensure that all historic Practice Management users are removed
via the 'Tools' > 'Manage users' window. When these old/unused accounts are deleted, please
restart Practice Management and the error should no longer appear.

title: Error adding time to the Time sheet; 'Service Provided is mandatory'
path: /Wiki - TAP UK Support/Wikipedia/Supported programs/DIGITA/Practice Management/Error adding time to the Time sheet; 'Service Provided is mandatory'
content:
**Problem** Error adding time to the Time sheet; 'Service Provided is mandatory'

**Solution**
When adding time to the time sheet the staff member gets the following error
![image.png](/.attachments/image-055ec7de-5e26-4726-9710-8ae0936b11b7.png)
This error will occur if the “Service on WIP” setting within the Advanced Options has been set to false (To view this
select File | Log on as Administrator. Then select Tools | Options | Advanced Options);
![image.png](/.attachments/image-f9268dec-1636-4a0b-b2d0-55e22341674f.png)
In order to resolve the error every staff member needs to have a Primary service set.
To do this;
- Open the staff card and click on the Employment tab.
- Remove the tick from the "Engaged with all services" box.
- Select New and highlight the relevant services the staff member provides and select OK
- To set the Primary service, double click on the intended Primary service.
- Tick the Primary service box
Close and re-open Digita Practice Management Now when you enter time the Primary service will be
selected by default.

title: Error Message 'The field 'Code' must have a unique value. The field 'Code' is invalid. You must correct the error before this form can be saved'
path: /Wiki - TAP UK Support/Wikipedia/Supported programs/DIGITA/Practice Management/Error Message 'The field 'Code' must have a unique value. The field 'Code' is invalid. You must correct the error before this form can be saved'
content:
**Problem**
Error Message 'The field 'Code' must have a unique value. The field 'Code' is invalid. You must correct the error before this form can be saved'.

**Solution**
Each code applied within the Practice Management database must be unique. If you attempt to use
the same code again this error message will appear.
![image.png](/.attachments/image-5d3ef111-8dda-4eba-862a-8cf9c164dd6f.png)
Please navigate to the Contact List (rather than the Client List) as this shows ALL the records in the database. Filter / sort to identify the record that already has the code: you can then decide whether to either re-code the original record - to allow you to use the code now or keep the code assigned to the original record and add a new code to the affected record.

Please note that the code field is only mandatory for Client records. If a record is in the database as a Contact only the code field can be left blank if you wish.

[Error Message 'The field 'Code' must have a unique value. The field 'Code' is invalid. You must correct the error before this form can be saved.pdf](/.attachments/Error%20Message%20'The%20field%20'Code'%20must%20have%20a%20unique%20value.%20The%20field%20'Code'%20is%20invalid.%20You%20must%20correct%20the%20error%20before%20this%20form%20can%20be%20saved-fa9ff202-5fbc-4c1d-83e3-2d7aa4b0b22c.pdf)

content:
**Problem**
Error Message 'Unhandled exception has occurred in your application... If you click continue and
access the affected record, the boxes are incorrectly named as uilabel or label1

**Solution**
The main body of the address for the affected client will be blank; this is causing the error.
Select Tools | Manage addresses
Find and edit the relevant address for the client.
Save and close out of Practice Management, then re-launch and you should be able to go into the
client without error.

title: Error: Word cannot give a document the same name as an open document
path: /Wiki - TAP UK Support/Wikipedia/Supported programs/DIGITA/Practice Management/Error: Word cannot give a document the same name as an open document
content:
**Problem**
Error: Word cannot give a document the same name as an open document.

**Solution**
The error below appears if you are producing an office document, such as an email, for multiple clients and the File name format for each of the documents is identical... and consequently only one email is produced
![image.png](/.attachments/image-d879b254-5ffb-4c1d-827e-3b573fbbb50e.png)
If the document name format only has the fields for 'date' and / or 'document name' selected this means that all documents created using the mail merge functionality at this point in time will have identical names and this results in the error occurring and only the first document is produced.

By adding the field 'client code' each document produced will have a unique name and the mail merge process will work successfully.

The document name format can either be set for individual mail merges when going through the steps in the mail merge wizard or set as a default format by the Administrator (log in as Administrator by going into the File drop down menu and selecting 'log on as Administrator') in Tools > Options > General Options and going into the Filenames tab.

[Error Word cannot give a document the same name as an open document.pdf](/.attachments/Error%20Word%20cannot%20give%20a%20document%20the%20same%20name%20as%20an%20open%20document-350f3226-311d-4b40-8024-558e4765c963.pdf)
